That historic introduction to senior football also brought the first of his 16 clean sheets in the MLS, as he helped secure a 0-0 draw against New York City. The teenager became a regular for Chicago Fire, playing all but the last two games of their 2022 league campaign prior to his departure. He made 43 appearances for the club in total.

content.title: Slonina gathers the ball for Chicago Fire

content.text: Slonina has also represented the USA at several youth levels and received his first senior international call-up in December 2021, being named on the bench for the USAâ€™s 1-0 friendly win over Bosnia and Herzegovina.

In August 2023, Slonina joined Belgian Pro League side K.A.S. Eupen on a season-long loan and immediately became their first-choice goalkeeper. He kept his first clean sheet in October in a victory over Charleroi.

Over the course of 2023/24, Slonina managed to accumulate over 3,000 minutes of experience with five clean sheets in his 34 appearances. However, his side were relegated to the Belgian second division.

For 2024/25 he joined League One Barnsley and made a spectacular start there, saving two penalties in a shoot-out win over Wigan in the Carabao Cup and earning the Player of the Match award and the competition's Player of the Round. He followed that up with another Player of the Match award for his performance in his second game, this time in a league win at Lincoln.

He had the chance to play at Old Trafford in the Carabao Cup although that ended in heavy defeat. A spell of injury followed from the end of October onwards and at the start of 2025, Slonina returned to Chelsea having made 14 appearances for Barnsley.
In January 2023, Slonina made his debut for the USA senior side in a game against Serbia, becoming the youngest goalkeeper to earn
Later in the year he played for the USA at the FIFA Under-20 World Cup and he was in the senior squad for the CONCACAF Gold Cup but remained an unused substitute.

tosin_adarabioyo.joined: Centre-back Tosin Adarabioyo joined Chelsea ahead of the 2024/25 season.
paragraphs: Centre-back Tosin Adarabioyo joined Chelsea ahead of the 2024/25 season. A tall player, Tosin brought with him his maturity and defensive qualities, and a wealth of experience of playing in the Premier League.

content.text: Tosinâ€™s first action for the Blues was as a starter in UEFA Conference League matches against Swiss side Servette. He made his Premier League bow for his new club as a substitute at Bournemouth before starting the next game away at West Ham - both games wins with clean sheets kept.
In November of his maiden season, Tosin's first Chelsea goal, a header, opened the floodgates in a Conference League-record 8-0 win at home to Noah.

content.title: Tosin celebrates scoring against Noah

content.text: In December and with Wesley Fofana suffering injury during that month, Tosin started five Premier League games.
In the FA Cup in early January, Tosin showed off his shooting skills. He opened the scoring and then added another in a 5-0 win over Morecambe - both with strikes from outside the penalty area.

content.title: Highlights: Chelsea 5-0 Morecambe
content.desc: Highlights of Chelsea's 5-0 FA Cup win against Morecambe FC at Stamford Bridge...

content.text: He then opened the scoring in a win against Wolves for his first Premier League goal for Chelsea, and he continued to share selection in the side with the other centre-backs in the squad.

He started the final two Premier League games of the season as Champions League qualification was secured with wins against Manchester United and Nottingham Forest. He was also selected for all the Conference League knockout stage matches prior to the final when he was on the bench.
Tosin had made 37 appearances, 30 of them as a starter, prior to the FIFA Club World Cup.
Born in London but raised in Manchester, Tosin began his career with Manchester City at the age of five. He moved through City's youth ranks and regularly captained their Under-18s at 16 years old.

His professional debut arrived in February 2016 at Stamford Bridge. Tosin started for a youthful Man City side in the FA Cup and went on to make seven more first-team appearances across the following two campaigns.

content.title: Tosin taking on Chelsea for Manchester City Under-21s back in October 2015

content.text: He had season-long loan spells in the EFL Championship with West Bromwich Albion and Blackburn Rovers before he left Man City permanently to join Fulham in October 2020.

Tosinâ€™s first campaign as a Premier League regular yielded 33 appearances and much praise for his adaptation to the top flight. He featured for Fulham on 44 occasions the following season and played an important role in the club securing promotion from the Championship.
He went on to make 45 top-flight appearances for Fulham, helping the Cottagers finish 10th and 13th respectively in the two seasons prior to him joining Chelsea.

benoit_badiashile.joined: Benoit Badiashile completed a permanent transfer to Chelsea from Monaco in January 2023, signing a seven-and-a-half-year contract at Stamford Bridge.
paragraphs: At 6ft 4in, Badiashile is a dominant defender in the air but equally comfortable with the ball at his feet, capable of playing short passes out from the back or switching the play with longer diagonals. His blistering speed is a key attribute and he has experience in both a back four and back three at club level.

content.text: Badiashile enjoyed a positive start to life in England, helping us earn clean sheets in his first three appearances, against Crystal Palace, Liverpool and Fulham. He even nearly scored the winner at Anfield, denied only by a fantastic Alisson save.

Badiashile was restricted to three appearances in April and May following the departure of Graham Potter, not helped by a serious hamstring injury sustained in training before our visit to Manchester City. He had however had a first Chelsea goal to celebrate before then, a well-executed volley in a win at Bournemouth.

content.title: Badiashile enjoys his first Chelsea goal

content.text: It took until the start of November 2023 for Badiashile to return from the hamstring injury that had ended his previous season but he returned in style, netting the opener with a tidy shot in a Carabao Cup win over Blackburn.

content.title: Celebration all around after Badiashile scores in his first game of the season

content.text: A run of regular matches followed and he registered an assist in a win over Brighton when he did well to keep the ball alive after a corner, allowing Enzo to score.
There was an appearance at left-back in a cup game against Villa but a groin injury suffered in the replay kept him out of a run of games, including the Carabao Cup final.

Badiashile returned to be a regular in the Premier League run-in, and although he had the misfortune to divert a shot in for a Bournemouth goal on the final day, that game, like the defenderâ€™s four previous appearances, was won as the Blues secured sixth place.
He finished the season with 22 games to his name and had our fourth-highest total for defensive blocks in the Premier League campaign.
Badiashile's action in the first half of the season was primarily in the UEFA Conference League, as Chelsea comfortably negotiated the first phase, and the Carabao Cup.
He did come into the Premier League side for starts in a win at Leicester in November and victory at Tottenham the following month, before a hamstring injury ruled him out of action.
Badiashile made his return when he started in the Round of 16 tie against Copenhagen in the European campaign.

content.title: Badiashile celebrates with the trophy after the UEFA Conference League final

content.text: He continued to be part of the side in that competition right up to the final when he played the first hour of the triumph over Real Betis.

Having grown up in the picturesque city of Limoges and signed for his hometown club aged eight, Badiashile spent much of his early career at lower-league side SC Malesherbes. It was from there that he joined Monaco as a 15-year-old with a growing reputation as a composed, left-footed centre-back at ease with the ball at his feet.

He made his initial breakthrough with the â€˜Bâ€™ team in the Championnat National 2, the French fourth tier, and watched at close quarters as Monaco secured a stunning Ligue 1 title and reached the Champions League semi-finals in 2016/17.

Splitting his time between representing Monacoâ€™s second team in the league and their Under-19s in the UEFA Youth League, Badiashile caught the eye at the end of 2017/18 and start of 2018/19, with his performances at those levels launching a rapid rise in the second of those campaigns.

He was handed his debut by Thierry Henry up against Thiago Silvaâ€™s Paris Saint-Germain in November 2018 at the age of 17 and instantly became an important member of their team, starting all but six of Monacoâ€™s remaining 31 matches in all competitions that season.

content.title: In Champions League action for Monaco against Atletico Madrid

content.text: Nowhere was the speed with which he made the step up to first-team football more apparent than in Europe, where he started the group stage captaining the Under-19s in the Youth League before starting the senior sideâ€™s last two Champions League group games against Atletico Madrid and Borussia Dortmund.

With Ligue 1 and Champions League debuts under his belt, the defender made a total of 25 appearances in his first season of senior football as Monaco fought an unlikely battle for top-flight survival, scoring his first goal with the equaliser in a 1-1 draw at home to Nice.

After helping France reach the semi-finals of the European Under-19 Championship, Badiashile embarked on his first full campaign of senior football as part of an improving Monaco side in 2019/20. Although the season was curtailed early due to the Covid-19 pandemic, with the principality side in mid-table, he managed 20 appearances in all competitions.

content.title: Celebrating his goal against Reims in Ligue 1

content.text: He made a flying start to the 2020/21 season when French football resumed, though, scoring in both of Monacoâ€™s opening two Ligue 1 fixtures, getting the equaliser as they came back from two goals down against Reims before firing in the only goal of a win at Metz.

He featured in all but three of Monacoâ€™s league games as they rose up the table to finish in third place, just five points behind champions Lille, in addition to four more appearances in their Coupe de France run, including in the 2-0 defeat to Paris Saint-Germain in the final.

content.title: Facing Paris Saint-Germain in the Coupe de France final

content.text: Despite being just 20 years old, Badiashile had unquestionably become a key figure in the Monaco side by the start of last season, playing 34 games despite missing the best part of three months due to a hamstring injury and Covid. He scored his only goal of 2021/22 in a 2-2 draw with Lens on the final day as they secured a second consecutive top-three finish.
He continued his impressive form into the 2022/23 season, scoring twice in 16 appearances for Monaco before joining Chelsea in January.
Having represented France throughout the youth ranks, all the way up from their Under-16s, Badiashile made his senior international debut not long before completing his move to Chelsea.

content.title: Deschamps congratulates Badiashile after his winning France debut

content.text: Following his increasingly impressive form for Monaco throughout 2023, he was given his debut from the start by France manager Didier Deschamps in September, playing the full 90 minutes of a 2-0 UEFA Nations League win over Austria in Paris. He added a second cap, also from the start, in Les Bleus final match of that Nations League campaign away in Denmark three days later.

jorrel_hato.joined: Jorrel Hato joined Chelsea at the start of August 2025 on a contract to 2032.
paragraphs: He is equally as comfortable in the heart of defence as he is at left-back, featuring most often in the latter position in the season before becoming a Blue. Hato is strong in the tackle, comfortable carrying the ball forward and has leadership skills that bely his age. He captained Ajax as a 17-year-old.

content.text: The Dutch international defender began his football career with local club Sparta Rotterdam before moving to Ajaxâ€™s youth academy in 2018. He signed his first professional contract in 2022 at just 16 and quickly made his mark in both the UEFA Youth League and for Jong Ajax, the clubâ€™s reserve side.

That same year, he became the third-youngest player ever to make his debut for Ajax in the Eredivisie, aged 16, in a match against Cambuur. By the end of the season, he was starting in the Dutch Cup final â€” a testament to his rapid rise.
He was still 16 when he became the third-youngest player to debut for Ajax in the Eredivisie in a game against Cambuur in February 2023. He finished the campaign starting in the Dutch Cup final.
From the start of the 2023/24 season, Hato was virtually ever-present in the Ajax side.

On the international stage, his progress has been equally impressive. Hato made his senior debut for the Netherlands aged 17, as well as captaining the Dutch side at the UEFA Under-21 European Championship this summer.

trevoh_chalobah.joined: Trevoh Chalobah signed for Chelsea as an Under-9 and came through the Academy to progress to the men's first team, as his older brother Nathaniel had done.
paragraphs: Having progressed through the youth ranks he made his initial breakthrough into senior football in 2018, with the first of three loan spells, before being brought back to Chelsea as part of Thomas Tuchel's squad for the start of the 2021/22 season, where he made an instant impact with a mixture of composure and passion at the back. Having continued to be a member of the squad under subsequent head coaches, he made a season-long loan move to Crystal Palace at the end of August 2024 but was recalled by Chelsea in January 2025. The following summer he became a full England international.

content.text: Chalobah could not have dreamed of a better start to life in the Chelsea senior set-up after joining Tuchel's squad for pre-season in 2021. After impressing the German, he was retained for the upcoming campaign and celebrated his debut by lifting silverware, as a composed performance belying his years contributed to the Blues beating Villarreal in the UEFA Super Cup on penalties following a 1-1 draw.

More was to come, as his first appearance in the Premier League also brought his first goal for Chelsea, when he arrowed a low drive into the bottom corner to complete a 3-0 victory over Crystal Palace at Stamford Bridge. He showed just how much the moment meant to him as he succumbed to the emotions and sunk to his knees in tears as his team-mates rushed to celebrate with him.

A further Premier League goal followed against Southampton, before he hit the net in the Champions League for the first time in a 4-0 thrashing of Juventus, but it was the seamless way he integrated and looked at home alongside his more experienced team-mates in Tuchel's back three that really caught the eye.

content.title: Showing his emotion after scoring on his Premier League debut

content.text: His versatility was also shown on occasion, when he provided an additional option in midfield as injury and Covid-19 depleted our ranks in early winter. It was a role he had fulfilled many times during his spells out on loan, although it was on the right of our defence where Tuchel alternated Chalobah with the more experienced Cesar Azpilicueta for large parts of the season.

However, the brutal winter schedule seemed to take its toll, as a couple of weeks sidelined with a hamstring injury in January was followed by a period out of the team, meaning he was an unused substitute for both games in Abu Dhabi as we triumphed at the FIFA Club World Cup the following month.

content.title: Winning the ball from Luis Diaz in the 2022 Carabao Cup final

content.text: When we returned from that tournament he soon found arguably his best form yet, though, notably playing through the pain despite a nasty gash from a high challenge which left him needing stitches to help us keep a clean sheet in the Carabao Cup final shoot-out defeat to Liverpool. He was also nominated for Premier League Player of the Month for his contribution to two clean sheets in that competition, in addition to opening the scoring in a win over Norwich City.

A dip in form, something Tuchel deemed inevitable for a young player in his first Premier League campaign, meant another absence for a time, but Chalobah returned to the starting line-up for a vital stage of the season. Another clean sheet at Wembley against Liverpool, this time in the FA Cup final, was sandwiched between a win at Leeds United and a draw with Leicester City which effectively secured our third-place finish in the Premier League.
Chalobah had to wait for his chance to impress when the 2022/23 campaign got underway, playing just once in the first two months of the season.

An injury to Wesley Fofana early in the home win over AC Milan handed Chalobah his chance, though, and it was one he seized, playing every minute of league and Champions League action until the World Cup break in mid-November. At the start of that run we accumulated six consecutive clean sheets, with Chalobah impressing in the heart of defence.

content.title: Chalobah dominating in the San Siro

content.text: Chalobah saw less action in the new year, especially in February and March, but he became a regular again under Frank Lampard, starting seven of our last eight league games as well as playing the full 90 minutes of our Champions League quarter-final second leg defeat to Real Madrid.

A lengthy injury delayed the start of Chalobah's season until February 2024, his return coming as a substitute in a draw away at Manchester City. He was also a late sub in the Carabao Cup final against Liverpool.

When back in the starting line-up from March onwards, a healthy set of results was recorded, and he headed home the opener in a London derby win over Tottenham that began the run of five victories which lifted the side up to table to the European qualification positions.

content.title: Trevoh celebrates breaching the Tottenham defence

content.text: Chalobah was defensively strong in the Spurs game too, including a block to deny Pape Sarr a goal. He was named Player of the Match.

Following his recall from loan at Crystal Palace, Chalobah was named in the starting line-up for the next game - a home win over Wolves. He was voted Player of the Match by users of the Official Chelsea App.

content.title: Trevoh Chalobah impressed on his return for Chelsea

content.text: He was used in FA Cup and UEFA Conference League games as well as Premier League outings and started both legs of the European Round of 16 tie against Copenhagen.
Having been used as a substitute in both legs of the semi-final against Djurgarden, Chalobah was handed a starting place in the final and played all 90 minutes of the victory over Real Betis.
In the Premier League he had amassed 11 starts and two substitute appearances in the second half of the campaign.
At the 2025 FIFA Club World Cup in the USA, against Flamengo, Chalobah made his 100th appearance for Chelsea.

Trevoh played predominantly in defence throughout his schoolboy years, mostly at right-back and centre-back but also occasionally in midfield. He featured on 10 occasions for our youth team while still a schoolboy, making his debut at the tender age of 14, and played for the Under-21s before signing as a scholar.

In 2015/16, Chalobah featured in every game en route to another FA Youth Cup final success for our youngsters and was a regular in our Under-19s team that retained their UEFA Youth League title. The following campaign saw him step up as a development squad regular, starting 25 of the 28 games at that age group. He also featured in all eight ties and scored semi-final and final goals as we won the Youth Cup for a fourth year running.

content.title: Chalobah with Mason Mount, Jacob Maddox and the FA Youth Cup

content.text: During 2017/18, he was named among the men's senior team's substitutes on occasions, including for the FA Cup final against Manchester United. His versatility was utilised by development squad manager Joe Edwards, who deployed the technically proficient youngster in a holding midfield role throughout the second half of the campaign, including during our run to the senior Checkatrade Trophy semi-finals.

In the summer of 2018, it was announced that Chalobah would be experiencing his first senior loan in the Championship at Ipswich, where he made 44 appearances and scored twice. His performances in central defence and midfield earned plaudits despite the Tractor Boys ultimately being relegated.

In August 2019, it was announced Chalobah would be spending the upcoming campaign back in the Championship with Huddersfield Town. Prior to heading to Yorkshire, the defender signed a new Chelsea contract committing him to the club until at least 2022. A mainstay in the The Terriers' defence, Chalobah played 37 times throughout the campaign, helping Huddersfield Town retain their Championship status.

content.title: Chalobah went up against Mount in the Championship in 2018/19

content.text: 2020 saw Chalobah move abroad for the first time agreeing to join newly-promoted Ligue 1 side Lorient. Splitting his playing time between the centre of defence and midfield, Chalobah's good performances caught the eye of many. In total he made 30 outings and scored two goals to help Lorient retain their place in the top flight of French football.

Soon after the start of the 2024/25 season, Chalobah made a Premier League loan switch to Crystal Palace. Having recovered from an injury, he made his debut there at the start of October and his third appearance, versus Spurs, was Palace's first league win of the season. It was immediately followed by a Carabao Cup victory at Villa.
In the next game, a 2-2 draw at Wolves, he completed 90 minutes and scored the opening goal, finishing well from a tight angle inside the box.

content.title: Chalobah nets his first goal for Palace

content.text: Chalobah featured in a League Cup quarter-final at Arsenal but Palace lost 3-2. He continued to be a regular choice and started 12 of Palaceâ€™s 13 Premier League matches up to the end of 2024, only missing their 5-1 home defeat to Arsenal during that run.
In a 2-1 win over Southampton, Chalobah was instrumental in Palaceâ€™s comeback both defensively and offensively. He scored the equaliser with his head from a corner.
He was recalled from loan by Chelsea midway through the January of the season, having made 14 appearances and scored three goals for the Eagles.

Chalobah wore the captain's armband for England Under-16s as the young Lions won the Montaigu Tournament in 2015/16. A regular throughout the England age groups, he captained the Under-17s at the European Championships for that age group in 2016 before winning the Under-19 version of the tournament in 2017.
Chalobah received his first call-up to the England Under-21s squad for European Championship qualifiers against Turkey and Kosovo in 2019, playing the duration in both matches.
In June 2025, he became a full England international when selected by his former Chelsea coach Thomas Tuchel for a friendly against Senegal at Nottingham Forest's City Ground. It ended in defeat.

malo_gusto.joined: Malo Gusto completed a permanent move from Lyon to Chelsea in January 2023, signing a contract to 2030.
paragraphs: The exciting young right-back then returned to Lyon on loan to spend the remainder of the 2022/23 season continuing his development in Ligue 1, before switching to London and making his Chelsea debut as a substitute in the opening game of the 2023/24 campaign.

content.text: By the end of his first season Gusto had made 37 appearances, 26 of them starts, and his six assists in the Premier League were only bettered as a total by two of his team-mates.

The first of those assists was in the third game of the season. In the side for the injured Reece James, his low cross against Luton was converted by Raheem Sterling. He had earlier played the pass to set Sterling away for a solo run and opening goal.

content.title: Gusto on the attack against Luton

content.text: A red card at home to Aston Villa in September was a hiccup but Gusto continued to be the most frequent selection at right-back for the rest of the season.

During the Christmas fixtures, his pass teed up a Mykhailo Mudryk goal in a win at home to Crystal Palace for which he was named Player of the Match, and shortly after, in an FA Cup tie against Preston, his pinpoint cross was headed home by Armando Broja. Crosses in two away London derbies led to goals for Conor Gallagher and Nicolas Jackson against Crystal Palace and Brentford respectively.
Jackson was also the beneficiary of a Gusto delivery as Villa were knocked out the FA Cup, as was Christopher Nkunku late in the season at Brighton.

content.title: Malo returned to the starting XI against Brighton

content.text: Gusto picked up another Player of the Match award from an FA Cup quarter-final against Leicester and he started in the semi-final versus Manchester City, having also played in the Carabao Cup final against Liverpool.
Although those games at Wembley were lost, Gusto earned plenty of praise for his first campaign in Chelsea blue.
With Reece James out of action at the start of the season, Malo Gusto was the choice at right-back when he was available.

Providing the attacking threat seen the previous season, he crossed low for a Christopher Nkunku goal in a cup win over Barrow. Another assist, this time for Jadon Sancho to complete the scoring in a big win against Southampton, came in Gusto's 50th game for the Blues.
In two games on Merseyside during the first half of the season, in the Premier League against Liverpool and Everton, Gusto was played at left-back.

It was a position repeated when the Conference League knockout stage commenced in Copenhagen but Gusto was forced off with an ankle injury. When he returned to fitness not long after it was at right-back, on occasions in the same team as James who played in midfield.

Though he was most often used as a substitute in the closing weeks of the Premier League season, Gusto started the second leg of the Conference League semi-final and final. He was withdrawn at half-time in the latter.

content.title: Gusto helped us to a win and a clean sheet against Djurgarden at the Bridge

content.text: Upon the completion of his transfer to Chelsea in January 2023, it was announced that Malo Gusto would continue his impressive progress on loan with Lyon at the Groupama Stadium before joining up with the Blues in the summer, ahead of the 2023/24 campaign.
However the rest of his season was affected by injury, limiting him to seven appearances following his signing for Chelsea
Malo Gusto progressed through the youth ranks at Lyon and made his senior debut in January 2021.

The following season was a breakthrough for the attack-minded full-back, becoming a regular for Lyon both domestically and in Europe. He registered four assists in 30 Ligue 1 appearances, while also helping his side reach the quarter-finals of the Europa League.

content.title: In Ligue 1 action for Lyon

content.text: That fine form has continued into the 2022/23 campaign under the stewardship of Laurent Blanc, with Gusto a key part of the OL backline and playing 15 times in the league prior to signing for Chelsea in January.
Malo Gusto has been capped by France at every level and after becoming a regular starter for the Under-21 side during 2022, he was handed his first senior cap in October 2023.

Having been a late call-up to the France squad due to injuries to others, including club team-mate Axel Disasi, he came on as a substitute in a win away against the Netherlands that qualified France for Euro 2024.  However he did not make the squad for the tournament itself.

content.title: Gusto made his senior France debut against the Netherlands in October 2023

content.text: Gusto's second senior cap was in May 2025 when he came on in the second half of a UEFA Nations League semi-final against Spain which ended 5-4 in his opponents' favour. He played the whole of the third-place play off - a 2-0 win over Germany.

aaron_anselmino.joined: Chelsea announced the signing of Aaron Anselmino in August 2024 after the Argentinian defender signed a seven-year contract with the Blues.
paragraphs: Anselmino spent time in the youth ranks of Juventud Unida and Sportivo Realico before joining Boca Juniors at the age of 12. He signed his first professional contract with the club on 10 June 2023, and was handed his first-team debut against Lanus on the same day.

content.text: The centre-back went on to make nine further appearances for Boca and scored his first senior goal for the club in April 2024, a winner in the Copa Sudamericana group stage against Trinidense.
After signing for Chelsea, Anselmino initially returned to his native Argentina to continue his development on loan with Boca Juniors.

In a 3-2 win over San Lorenzo in August 2024, he assisted two of the goals. Having scored a winner in Copa Sudamericana match at the start of October, he scored an opener with his head in a Copa Argentina tie against Gimnasia, with Boca Juniors eventually winning on penalties.

At the start of 2025 and having made 18 appearances in his loan spell with his former club, he returned to Chelsea. He was named on the bench for consecutive games against Brighton in the FA Cup and Premier League, as well as playing for the Under-21s against Liverpool.
He was on the bench for Chelsea's opening games at the 2025 FIFA Club World Cup. He then made his club debut when he came on towards the end of extra-time in the Round of 16 win over Benfica.

josh_acheampong.joined: Josh Acheampong first joined us in our development centre programme as an Under-8 and has the capabilities to play in multiple positions across the back line.
paragraphs: Having progressed through the Academy, he made his menâ€™s first team debut three days before his 18th birthday. That was at the end of a strong 2023/24 season in which he operated as a centre-half or a right full-back, demonstrating his comfort in possession of the ball and his ability in one-v-one defensive situations, stepping in to create overloads and initiate attacks. Halfway through the following campaign he was confirmed as a full-time member of the senior squad.

content.text: At the start of 2024 Acheampong signed his first professional contract. In the final month of that season he made his men's first team debut when brought on by Mauricio Pochettino for the closing minutes of a win at home to Tottenham.

content.title: Acheampong had a memorable senior Chelsea debut in our 2-0 win over Tottenham at the Bridge

content.text: In the summer of 2024, Acheampong was part of the senior squad that went to the United States for pre-season and he came on in the second half of a Carabao Cup tie at home to Barrow, in September 2024.
His first start came in the UEFA Conference League in the December. He was selected at right-back in Kazakhstan when the Blues took on Astana.

content.title: Acheampong playing in the Carabao Cup against Barrow at Stamford Bridge

content.text: Later that same month, Acheampong signed a new Chelsea contract committing himself to the club until 2029. He was confirmed as a full-time member of the men's first team squad.

In the first game of 2025, a draw away at Crystal Palace, Acheampong was given his first Premier League action when he played the whole game at centre-back alongside Levi Colwill. He was voted Player of the Match by fans on the Official Chelsea App.
Gaining experience as a central defender, a full-back and at wing-back, Acheampongâ€™s time in the Academy has been marked by a fantastic attitude towards developing further and a strong mentally.

These qualities were also identified internationally as he represented England at Under-16 level in the 2021/22 season, moving on to play at each level up to Under-20s whom he began to represent at the start of the 2024/25 season.
The youngster continued his growth at Chelsea in the 2022/23 season as he featured regularly under both Ed Brand and Hassan Sulaiman for the Under-18s.
His memorable moment of that season was a fantastic strike from distance against Tottenham in the Under-18s Premier League.

Acheampong also featured heavily for the England Under-17s side and was part of the squad which competed at the Under-17 European Championships in the summer of 2023 and the Under-17 World Cup the following November. He scored against New Caledonia.

content.title: AAcheampong put in an assured performance on his full Premier League 2 debut

content.text: In 2023/24 he added Chelsea Under-21 appearances to his continuing games for the Under-18s. He played an important role in the winning of the U18 Premier League southern title and headed the Chelsea goal in a 2-1 defeat by Manchester United in the U18 Premier League national final at Stamford Bridge.

dario_essugo.joined: Dario Essugo signed for Chelsea from Sporting Lisbon at the start of June 2025.
paragraphs: The midfielder signed a contract until 2033 having spent the previous season on loan in Spainâ€™s La Liga with Las Palmas. Against Los Angeles in our opening group game in the 2025 FIFA Club World Cup, he came on late in the game to make his Chelsea debut.

content.text: A graduate of Sporting's academy, Essugo made his senior debut for that club aged 16 years and six days. That appearance against Vitoria de Guimaraes in March 2021 made him Sportingâ€™s youngest-ever player and later that year aged 16 years, 11 months and 17 days, he broke a record previously held by Luis Figo as their youngest starter.

Essugo also gained experience on loan at another Portuguese side, Chaves, in the second half of the 2023/24 campaign before further outings for Sporting and the loan to Las Palmas. There he established himself as a regular, making 27 appearances and scoring one goal in all competitions.
Essugo is a Portugal Under-21 international having played at the younger age groups from Under-15 upwards.

andrey_santos.joined: A teenage Andrey Santos completed his permanent transfer to Chelsea from Vasco da Gama in January 2023.
paragraphs: He operated primarily in a box-to-box midfield role prior to joining the Blues, combining the defensive instincts he showed from a young age with an attacking threat in the opposition box. In March 2023 until the end of June, Santos returned to Vasco da Gama on loan before moving to England for the start of the 2023/24 season, initially on loan in the Premier League at Nottingham Forest and then a high-achieving spell at Strasbourg. On his return he was announced as a member of the Chelsea squad to compete for the 2025 FIFA Club World Cup. He made his debut as a substitute in the group stage against ES Tunis.

content.text: Having helped Vasco da Gama earn promotion back to Serie A before joining Chelsea, Andrey Santos returned to the Rio de Janeiro club on loan in March 2023 to play a part in their return to the Brazilian top flight. He returned to Chelsea in July 2023.

In late August 2023, it was announced he would embark on a season-long loan at Premier League level, moving to Nottingham Forest. Having played a game in the Carabao Cup, he made his first Premier League appearance as a substitute in Anfield in late October.
Having played two games at Forest, Santos returned to Chelsea in January 2024 before moving on loan to Strasbourg on mid-season transfer deadline day.
He made his debut in mid-February when he came on during a defeat by Lorient. A month later he played his first 90 minutes in Strasbourg's first Ligue 1 win of 2024, a victory over Nantes.
Enjoying a good run of games towards the end of the season, he won the Ligue 1 Young Player of the Month award for March and Strasbourgâ€™s Player of the Month for April.
He made nine starts and two substitute appearances in France, scoring with his head against Metz in the penultimate game of the season.

Back at Strasbourg for 2024/25, Santos scored the opening goal in an early season win over Rennes and followed that up with a headed goal in a defeat at Lyon. He won the Ligue 1 Young Player of the Month award for his performances in August.

His third goal of the season came in a 3-3 draw at Lille in September, with another two following a month later in a 3-1 home win over Nantes. Both were close-range finishes. In November he captained the side in a game against Nice.
In December, Santos scored in successive 3-0 wins, one in the league and one in the cup. That took his season's total to seven goals and he was named Strasbourg's player of the month.
The next month, he scored with a volley from outside the box to begin a fightback from being a goal down to beat Lille.

In March 2025, Santos was named Strasbourg captain for a win at Nantes and retained that duty against Toulouse, a game in which he scored the winning goal. His 10th goal of the season came when he headed in a corner in a victory over Lyon as his side continued to climb the table. He collected another of Strasbourg's Player of the Month awards.
Strasbourg's run of good form continued towards the end of the season and they recorded their longest unbeaten run in Ligue 1 since 1982.
Santos provided assists for both goals in a draw with Nice and he was nominated for Ligue 1's best young player of the season.

content.title: Celebrating a goal against Le Havre in May 2025

content.text: His loan club ended the Ligue 1 season in seventh place, qualifying for the UEFA Conference League play-off round. On a personal level Santos made 34 appearances in all competitions in 2024/25, scoring 11 goals and supplying five assists. He was the highest-scoring central midfielder in Ligue 1.
He came second in Strasbourg's Player of the Season voting, behind Djordje Petrovic.

Andrey Santos progressed through the ranks at Vasco da Gama, his boyhood club, and helped them to promotion to the top flight with a third-place finish in Serie B in 2022, during which he played 33 times and scored eight goals.

content.title: On the defensive with Vasco da Gama against Flamengo in the Campeonato Carioca

content.text: Santos made his debut at just 17, as a late substitute in the Campeonato Carioca, a tournament for teams in the local area of Rio de Janeiro. He played most of that campaign for the clubâ€™s Under-20 side and impressed in a box-to-box midfield role in which he regularly contributed with goals and assists.
His league debut came on the final day of the 2021 season, before he became a more prominent figure in the 2022 campaign, earning himself a regular spot in the midfield trio.

Andrey Santos represented Brazil at youth level from Under-16s to Under-20s and captained his country to continental glory in the older age group, at the Under-20 CONMEBOL Championship in February 2023, shortly after joining Chelsea.

content.title: Santos celebrates his goal for Brazil against Uruguay at the 2023 CONMEBOL Under-20 Championships

content.text: The midfielder was the competition's joint-top scorer, along with team-mate Vitor Roque, after netting an impressive six goals in his eight appearances. The most important of those came in their last game, as he opened the scoring in a 2-0 victory over Uruguay which saw them crowned South American champions, finishing one point above their opponents in the table.
He also played in the Under-20 World Cup in the summer of 2023 and went out at the quarter-final stage.
In March 2023, Santos made his senior Brazil debut in a friendly against Morocco.

In September 2023, he captained Brazil Under-23s in friendlies that served as preparation for the following summerâ€™s Olympic Games. He then featured in a CONMEBOL pre-Olympic tournament at the start of 2024 but his nation failed to qualify for the Paris Olympics.
In early June 2025, he came on late in a senior Brazil game, a World Cup qualifier against Ecuador.

romeo_lavia.joined: Chelsea completed the signing of midfielder Romeo Lavia from Southampton in August 2023 on an initial seven-year contract.
paragraphs: Upon arriving at Chelsea, the central midfielder had already demonstrated his quality in the Premier League during his season playing in that competition at Southampton, showing maturity despite his young age.

content.text: The start to Laviaâ€™s career at Stamford Bridge was delayed by an ankle injury. He missed the first half of the 2023/24 season before making his debut when he came on for the final half-hour of a home win over Crystal Palace in late December.
However he sustained a significant thigh injury in that same game and following a setback in his recovery, it was confirmed in late March 2024 that he would not feature again in the season.

Following his injury-stricken 2023/24 campaign, Lavia started the first game of the next season, at home to Manchester City. There was also a substitute appearance in the UEFA Conference League before suffering a hamstring injury.

He returned when he came on against Brighton in late September and he embarked on a run of good form partnering Moises Caicedo in central midfield, as the team put together an impressive run of results.

However, following his half-time withdrawal in a victory at Tottenham in early December, injury kept him out for the rest of 2024. He returned to action when Morecambe were defeated at the Bridge in the third round of the FA Cup and followed that up with a Premier League game against Bournemouth.
There was then a two-month absence before coming on away against Arsenal in March 2025.
Although not part of the UEFA Conference League squad, Lavia was involved in the final five Premier League games of the season, three of them as a starter.
Lavia started his career with Anderlecht in his native Belgium and spent eight years with the club before joining Manchester City at the age of 16.

He impressed for the clubâ€™s Under-18s and Elite Development Squad and made his senior debut in September 2021. Lavia started in the EFL Cup against Wycombe Wanderers and helped his side to a 6-1 win.
Lavia made one further first-team appearance for City before completing a switch to Southampton in the summer of 2022.

In a campaign that ended in relegation for the Saints, Lavia made 34 appearances. He caught the eye with several impressive performances, including in a surprise Southampton victory at Stamford Bridge in February.

After representing Belgium in several youth age groups, Lavia received his first call-up to the senior team in March 2023, aged 19. He was among the substitutes for a Euros qualifying win against Sweden that month before being handed his debut from the bench in a 3-2 friendly victory over Germany four days later.

liam_delap.joined: Liam Delap became a Chelsea player in early June 2025, joining from Ipswich Town and signing a contract until 2031.
paragraphs: The strikerâ€™s previous season had also been spent in the top flight and he scored 12 goals in 37 league appearances for Ipswich and was named on the shortlist for Premier League Young Player of the Year award.

content.text: The strikerâ€™s previous season had also been spent in the top flight and he scored 12 goals in 37 league appearances for Ipswich and was named on the shortlist for Premier League Young Player of the Year award.

He enjoyed a standout campaign. He netted 24 goals in 20 Premier League 2 matches, scored on his debut for Man Cityâ€™s senior side in the League Cup, and was handed his first top-flight appearance against Leicester City.
Further appearances followed during the 2021/22 season before he embarked on loan spells at Stoke City and Preston North End.
Delap spent the 2023/24 season with Hull City and, after scoring eight goals, secured a move to newly-promoted Ipswich Town.

His Chelsea debut came soon after his transfer, in our opening match of the 2025 FIFA Club World Cup when he came on against Los Angeles. He crossed for Enzo Fernandez to score a goal. His own first goal came in the same group stage with a sharp turn and composed finish against ES Tunis.
Delap has represented England throughout the youth age groups up to Under-21 level.

jamie_gittens.joined: Jamie Gittens joined from Borussia Dortmund on 5 July 2025, with the winger signing a contract until 2032.
paragraphs: Though predominantly a left winger, Gittens is comfortable playing on either flank and also featured as a no. 10 for Borussia Dortmund as well as in a deeper role across the midfield.

content.text: Gittens had played in the Reading and Chelsea youth systems before moving to Manchester Cityâ€™s academy at the age of 14. He made the move to Germany from Man City in 2020 and quickly established himself as part of the menâ€™s first-team squad at Signal Iduna Park. He made his debut late in the 2021/22 season before having a breakout campaign the following term, netting his first senior goal in August of that year.

The player featured heavily across the Bundesliga, the Champions League and the DFB-Pokal, making 20 appearances and scoring three goals. The following season, he registered 10 goal contributions in 34 appearances across all competitions, including appearing as a substitute in the 2024 Champions League final against Real Madrid.
Gittens continued to impress for Dortmund during the 2024/25 campaign with 17 goal contributions across all competitions, before featuring for the German side in the FIFA Club World Cup.
He been capped at Under-21 level for England having previously started in the side that won the Under-19 European Championship in 2022.

nicolas_jackson.joined: Chelsea announced the signing of Nicolas Jackson from Spanish side Villarreal at the end of June 2023.
paragraphs: The Senegal international signed an eight-year contract following a breakout 2022/23 campaign in La Liga in which he struck 12 goals. In 2024 he extended his Chelsea deal to 2033. He is a striker who poses a dual threat to opposition defenders, having both the pace to run in behind and the willingness to drop deep, hold the ball up and link play.

content.text: Jackson made his Chelsea debut on the opening day of the 2023/24 season when we hosted Liverpool, and notched his maiden goal versus Luton Town at Stamford Bridge two appearances later.

Following further goals against Brighton in the Carabao Cup and away at Burnley, Jackson netted his first Chelsea hat-trick at the start of November 2023, in a dramatic 4-1 win at Tottenham when the hosts were reduced to nine players.

content.title: Jackson completes his Tottenham hat-trick

content.text: He also found the net in the next game against eventual champions Man City, before a first assist of the season in December when he headed the ball into the danger area for Levi Colwill to score against Brighton.

He found the target once more, against Sheffield United, before time away playing at the Africa Cup of Nations early in 2024. There was also a handful of appearances on the left wing with Cole Palmer in the centre in the middle of the season, including in an impressive FA Cup win at Aston Villa when Jackson headed one of the goals, as he did in a Premier League draw at Brentford.

content.title: Against Leeds, Jackson nets Chelsea's 5,000th goal at Stamford Bridge

content.text: By then he was back at centre-forward for the remainder of a season that ended with a flourish. An opener against Newcastle made it three goals in three games and in April, he netted arguably his best Chelsea goal yet, a sharp strike on the turn in a 6-0 win over Everton.

As Chelsea won our last five games of the campaign, Jackson scored against Tottenham (taking him past the league goals total in the first season from Didier Drogba, one of his heroes growing up), found the net twice and assisted for one versus West Ham, and headed in a memorable late winner in a turnaround at Nottingham Forest.

That gave him 17 goals in 44 appearances in 2023/24, second top scorer to Cole Palmer, whom he was also second to for shots on and off target in the league. The Senegalese was our fifth-highest appearance maker in a season in which he notably improved his ability to avoid bookings and settled into his role of spearhead after some earlier misses.
Jackson scored twice in the first three league games of the season, after only two minutes in a big win away at Wolves before finishing off a counter-attacking move at home to Crystal Palace.

content.title: Jackson scores our first league goal of 2024/25

content.text: He celebrated his good start to the campaign by, in mid-September, signing a contract extension to 2033.

Away at West Ham his pace and movement were too much for the Irons' defence as he scored twice early on in a 3-0 win that was his 50th Chelsea appearance. He also set up Cole Palmer for his goal in that game, one of three assists supplied before the October international break.

content.title: Highlights: West Ham 0-3 Chelsea
content.desc: Highlights of Chelsea's 3-0 Premier League away win against West Ham United at the London Stadium...

content.text: Following a goal in a narrow defeat at Anfield at the end of that month, Jackson's next goal, when he finished off a fine move involving a brilliant Palmer pass and a Pedro Neto cross, was named Premier League Goal of the Month. That was in a home win over Newcastle.

content.title: Highlights: Chelsea 2-1 Newcastle
content.desc: Highlights of Chelsea's 2-1 Premier League win against Newcastle United at Stamford Bridge...

content.text: Three more goals followed in 2024 as Jackson continued to be the team's predominant centre-forward in the Premier League.

He made the most of hesitant Leicester defending to put the Blues 1-0 up in a win there. In his next game, at home to Villa, he converted a Marc Cucurella cross for the opener again, and back at the Bridge, his run from halfway and near-post finish proved to be the winner against Brentford.

content.title: Jackson opens the scoring at the King Power Stadium

content.text: In early February, a hamstring injury suffered against West Ham kept Jackson out of the frontline for two months but he returned for a London derby win against Spurs at Stamford Bridge.

His first goal since his return was the only one in a win over Everton and having scored twice in the semi-final to help Chelsea to the UEFA Conference League final, it was Jackson who bundled Cole Palmer's cross into the net to give his team the lead in the eventual 4-1 triumph.
He finished the regular season with 13 goals from 34 games.

Having been shown a red card at Newcastle that brought an early end to his Premier League season due to suspension, Jackson was sent off in Chelsea's second game at the FIFA Club World Cup which led to a two-match ban.
The 22-year-oldâ€™s club career began at Senegal Premier League side Casa Sports before a move to Villarreal in September 2019.

Jacksonâ€™s first taste of senior European football came on loan at Spanish second-tier side Mirandes. A campaign in Villarrealâ€™s B side followed and he helped the side seal promotion from the third tier with both goals in their play-off final victory.
The young forward established himself in the senior set-up in the summer of 2022 and went on to make 38 appearances across all competitions for Villarreal.
He ended the campaign as La Ligaâ€™s in-form player, scoring nine goals in the final eight matches of the season and winning the Player of the Month award for May.

Jackson's form for Villarreal earned a first call-up for Senegal squad for the 2022 World Cup. He made his international debut at the tournament in Qatar, as a substitute in their opening group game against the Netherlands.
He followed that up with two further caps in June 2023, getting an assist in each, including in a prestigious 4-2 friendly victory over Brazil.

Having been called up for the Africa Cup of Nations at the start of 2024, Jackson came on as a substitute in all three group games as Senegal qualified for the knockout phase with a 100 per cent record. He played a key role in his side's third and final goal in a win over Cameroon in the second of those outings that sealed their progress.

content.title: Jackson played in all four of Senegal's matches at the Africa Cup of Nations

content.text: However in the last-16 stage, the reigning champions went out on penalties after a 1-1 draw with home nation Ivory Coast. Again Jackson was a second-half sub but he was not involved in the shoot-out.

In October 2024, in a qualifier for the next Africa Cup of Nations, he scored his first international goal. It was the fourth goal in a 4-0 win over Malawi. In the next match, which was against the same opposition, a win ensured Senegal would be at the tournament finals in Morocco in December 2025.
In June 2025, Jackson played and registered an assist against England in Senegal's 3-1 win in a friendly in Nottingham.

christopher_nkunku.joined: Christopher Nkunku joined Chelsea from RB Leipzig ahead of the 2023/24 season, signing a six-year contract.
paragraphs: The versatile France international started in midfield before moving further forward and becoming a skilful and prolific forward, equally adept at creating or scoring chances.

content.text: Unfortunately the start to Nkunkuâ€™s Chelsea career was delayed by a knee injury sustained in a pre-season game that required surgery. He was able to make his delayed debut in December 2023, coming on in the second half of a Carabao Cup match against Newcastle, and successfully converting a penalty in a shoot-out which decided the tie.

He followed that up with a late goal in a Christmas Eve Premier League defeat at Wolves, and then after a month out with a hip injury, returned as a half-time substitute at Anfield and scored a quality goal, albeit a consolation one in a defeat there.

content.title: Nkunku scores his first Chelsea goal at Molineux

content.text: When we played Liverpool again in the Carabao Cup final, Nkunku featured as a substitute but a hamstring injury suffered at Wembley kept him out throughout March and April.
He returned to play a part in the final four games of the season â€“ all victories â€“ and he scored the winner in the penultimate game of the season away at Brighton.

Having scored home and away in our UEFA Conference League play-off tie against Servette, both goals from the penalty spot, Nkunku netted his first Premier League goal of the season in the fourth game in that competition.
It was the only goal of the game and a late winner at Bournemouth, scored just seven minutes after he came on.
Against Barrow in the first domestic cup-tie of the season, Nkunku scored his first Chelsea hat-trick - with a volley, a back-heel flick and then a shot after winning the ball off the goalkeeper.

content.title: Highlights: Chelsea 5-0 Barrow
content.desc: Catch the best bits from Chelsea's 5-0 Carabao Cup victory against Barrow at Stamford Bridgeâ€¦

content.text: He also scored in the Conference League against Gent and with seven goals, was the team's top scorer going into the October international break.

A penalty converted against Noah in the Conference League in the November was Chelsea's 500th spot-kick scored in all competitions in our history. With a goal against Heidenheim, he became the first Chelsea player to score in six consecutive European games and his second Premier League goal of the season came in December at Southampton.
His first goal of 2025 came in the FA Cup when he made up for a saved penalty against Morecambe by finding their net in open play.

Nkunku's next Premier League goal came the next month when he scored the opener in a comfortable home win over Southampton. Two matches later, in March, he played his 50th Chelsea game when we played at home to Leicester.
He started both legs of the UEFA Conference League quarter-final against Legia Warsaw but injury meant he missed the semi-final. He remained on the bench in Poland at the final.

Nkunku is a graduate of the famed French national football academy at Clairefontaine and started his professional career at Paris Saint-Germain. He made 78 first-team appearances and was involved in three Ligue 1 title wins and two Coupe de France triumphs before departing for RB Leipzig in the summer of 2019.

It is in Germany that Nkunku built his reputation as one of the finest forwards in European football. He scored 35 goals in all competitions during the 2021/22 campaign and was named Bundesliga Player of the Season and German PFA Player of the Season. The DFB-Pokal was also won.
The versatile attacker struck a further 23 goals this season to help Leipzig secure a third-place finish in the Bundesliga and retain the DFB-Pokal.

Nkunku made his senior debut for France from the start in a friendly win over Ivory Coast in March 2022. He was called up for that year's winter World Cup, but missed out on the tournament due to injury.
However, he returned and earned his ninth and tenth caps for his country shortly before joining Chelsea in the summer of 2023, in a European Championship qualifiers against Gibraltar and Greece.
Following an injury hit first season at Stamford Bridge, Nkunku was not selected by France for Euro 2024.
He returned to the national side the following October and scored first goal for France during his first game back, a Nations League win over Israel.

tyrique_george.joined: Tyrique George is a tricky and exciting player who joined us as an Under-8 after coming through our development centre programme. He operates predominantly on the left wing but can also play as an attacking midfielder.
paragraphs: Having made his menâ€™s first-team debut early in the 2024/25 season, he moved from the Academy to be a full-time member of the senior squad midway through that campaign.

content.text: George made his debut for the men's first team when he came on during the second half of a UEFA Conference League play-off match away in Switzerland, against Servette. He made further substitute appearances in the same competition versus Gent and in a Carabao Cup match against Barrow. He also played for England Under-19s near the start of the season.

content.title: Eighteen-year-old Tyrique George during his Stamford Bridge bow

content.text: Against Noah in the Conference League George was given his first Chelsea start. The team were 6-0 up in an eventual 8-0 win when he came off with 68 minutes played to applause around the ground. In the same competition, following a short substitute appearance away at Heidenheim, George played the full 90 minutes of a win against Astana in Kazakhstan and was involved in plenty of the Blues' attacking play. Another full game came in the final league-phase match at home to Shamrock Rovers.
In December 2024, it was confirmed George was now a full-time member of the men's first-team squad.

Against Morecambe in the FA Cup the next month, he registered his first assists with passes for long-range strikes by Tosin Adarabioyo and Joao Felix, before in February he added a Premier League assist. That was when he reached the byline and cut the ball back for Marc Cucurella to score.

George's first senior goal came in April 2025 in Poland, when he turned the ball in after a Reece James shot was saved. That opened the scoring in a 3-0 win over Legia Warsaw in the first leg of a UEFA Conference League quarter-final.

content.title: George opens his Chelsea account

content.text: His first Premier League goal was an important one, a late equaliser soon after coming on at Fulham. That was converted by Pedro Neto into a long-awaited away win and a crucial three points in the ultimately success attempt to qualify for the Champions League.

At the start of the next month George was named the Chelsea Menâ€™s Academy Player of the Year. He followed that up with his first Premier League start when handed the central striker role at home to Manchester United with Nicolas Jackson suspended.

During his time developing in the Chelsea Academy, George represented England at Under-16 level frequently in the 2021/22 season and was part of the Val de Marne international tournament-winning squad for that age group.

The pacy and direct winger was a big part of the Under-18s side in the 2022/23 season, featuring regularly under both Ed Brand and Hassan Sulaiman over the course of that season. He made 28 appearances across all competitions, 18 of them starts.

George played internationals at Under-17 level and at the start of 2023/24, he moved up to England Under-18s. As the season progressed at club level, he scored eye-catching goals in the title-winning Under-18s' season and for the Under-21s. Across both age groups he netted 20 times, eight for the U21s.

content.title: Tyrique George netted the winner for our Under-21s' first victory of 2024 against Man Utd

content.text: Towards the end of the season he also made the bench on three occasions for the senior side and in the summer of 2024 he travelled to the United States to be part of the pre-season tour.

While involved with the menâ€™s first team squad in 2024/25, for our Under-21s George recorded a hat-trick against Brentford in the Premier League Cup group stage and added a goal in a dominant 6-0 victory over Fulham at Motspur Park.
Midway through the season he was confirmed as a full-time member of Enzo Maresca's squad and at the end of it, he won the Menâ€™s Academy Player of the Year.

estevao.joined: Estevao joined Chelsea from Palmeiras in the summer of 2025, with the deal to sign the teenage forward having been announced the year before.
paragraphs: Prior to the move, the Brazilian had already built a strong reputation as one of the most exciting young talents in South America due to his skilful dribbling and electric pace.

content.text: Having made his debut for Palmeiras in 2023 at the age of 16, he caused defences plenty of problems in his next, breakout season in senior football, featuring 31 times in Brazilâ€™s Serie A and contributing 13 goals and nine assists, as well as finding the net in the Copa Libertadores and Copa do Brasil.

In 2025 he scored four times in five Copa Libertadores appearances before featuring for Palmeiras at the FIFA Club World Cup in the summer. He played in every game as his side reached the quarter-finals where he netted an outstanding goal in a defeat by Chelsea.

At international level, Estevao played for Brazil Under-17s before being promoted to the senior squad for World Cup qualifiers. His first cap was won in September 2024 when he came on during a home win against Ecuador and three more substitute appearances followed before his first start â€“ with Ecuador again the opposition. That was in June 2025 away from home with the result this time a 0-0 draw. He had five caps to his name by the time of his switch to Chelsea.

mykhilo_mudyrk.joined: Mykhailo Mudryk completed a move from Shakhtar Donetsk to Chelsea in January 2023.
paragraphs: The Ukrainian international turned 22 a couple of weeks before putting pen to paper on his eight-and-a-half year contract with the Blues. A skillful player with plenty of pace, Mudryk quickly built a reputation as one of the most dangerous attacking players in Europe in one-v-one situations during his time with Shakhtar Donetsk. Primarily a wide player, he featured on both wings in Ukraine, but many of his best performances have come when cutting in from the left onto his preferred right foot.

content.text: Mudryk made his Chelsea debut off the bench in a goalless draw at Anfield, immediately catching the eye with his turn of pace and skill. He wasn't far away from netting a winning goal, too.

He made his full debut a fortnight later, against Fulham, although most of his appearances did come off the bench in his first half-season as he built up his match fitness after a couple of months with no action, and adapted to the rigours of Premier League football.

content.title: Mykhailo Mudryk impressed on his Chelsea debut at Liverpool

content.text: Usually deployed on the left flank, Mudryk recorded assists against Leicester and Brighton and went close to his maiden Blues goal on several occasions.
Mudryk's first Chelsea goal came when he netted the opener in a 2-0 win away at Fulham in October 2023.
His second, scored with a strike from out wide at Stamford Bridge that sailed over the head of Arsenal keeper David Raya, was voted Chelsea Goal of the Month for October.

The forward had a productive spell in spring 2024 with a goal in the FA Cup against Leeds and another against Newcastle (in the Premier League this time), while also netting in a play-off to send Ukraine to Euro 2024. The goal against the Tynesiders was a brilliant dribble through the heart of their defence.

content.text: Mudryk's greatest involvement came towards the season's end as the team's form picked up and he scored in a win at Forest, although concussion forced him to miss the final game.
He finished with seven goals from 23+18 appearances in the 2023/24 campaign.

Though largely one of the substitutes for the Premier League matches in the early months of the season, Mudryk started in the UEFA Conference League and provided assists in games against Servette and Genk.

content.title: Mudryk on the move against Servette

content.text: He then scored in three consecutive European appearances, adding a headed goal to two assists away against Panathinkaikos, finding the top corner from long range against Noah, and then repeating the trick to double the lead over Heidenheim.
In December 2024, a club statement was issued regarding the player.

Having been born in the Ukrainian city of Krasnograd, not far from Kharkiv, the young Mykhailo Mudryk spent his formative football years in the academy at local club Metalist Kharkiv. In 2014, at the age of 13, he switched to the larger outfit of Dnipro Dnipropetrovsk, before being spotted by Shakhtar Donetsk and joining them two years later.

At the age of 17, Mudryk was handed a first-team debut in a Ukrainian Cup match, a 3-2 win over local rivals Olimpik Donetsk, his only appearance in a competition Shakhtar would win that season. The next step was a loan move â€“ to Arsenal Kyiv where the teenager had his first taste of league football.
In 2019/20, back at Shakhtar, Mudryk predominantly played development football, but did contribute three appearances to a successful Ukraine league championship-winning campaign by the senior side.
After a loan to Desna Chernigiv for 2020/21, which added a further 10 league appearances to his growing experience, the time had come to establish himself at his parent club.

content.text: That happened in earnest when Roberto De Zerbi took over as Shakhtar manager in May 2021. Mudryk scored his first goal in a 5-0 league win over Mariupol in October 2021 and featured in every Champions League group-stage game that season, including matches against Real Madrid and Inter Milan.

He was a regular in the domestic league, although it was a competition that was ultimately terminated due to the Russian invasion of Ukraine. Mudryk was named the Shakhtar Donetsk Player of the Year for 2021, an honour repeated the following year when he was also named Ukraineâ€™s Footballer of the Year for 2022.

content.text: In 2022/23, before his mid-season move to Chelsea, Mudryk opened Shakhtarâ€™s Champions League campaign with a goal and two assists in a 4-1 away win at RB Leipzig. He also found the net home and away in 1-1 draws with Celtic, while he was a regular scorer in Ukraineâ€™s Premier Liga, netting six times in his final eight appearances for the club.
In total in his time with Shakhtar, Mudryk scored 12 goals in 44 appearances, including three in the Champions League.
Mudryk was first capped at Under-16 level by his nation while progressing in the Shakhtar Donetsk development system.
For Ukraineâ€™s senior side he was handed his international debut as a substitute in a qualification play-off for the Qatar World Cup, in a victory against Scotland.

content.title: Celebrating a win over Scotland on his Ukraine debut

content.text: That was soon followed by another sub appearance when they were eliminated by Wales, before a first start in the UEFA Nations League against the Republic of Ireland. He received eight caps in total during 2022.

In October 2023, Mudyrk put in a performance of real quality as Ukraine came from behind to defeat Malta in a crunch Euro 2024 qualifier. In a 3-1 win, he first earned a penalty for his side before netting a goal for himself late on.
Ukraine made it through to the qualification stage and in March 2024, it was Mudryk who scored a late winner against Iceland to send his nation to the finals in Germany.

He was selected for the squad for the Euro 2024 tournament and having been his side's most creative player in a defeat by Ukraine in the opening group game, he was again prominent as they fought back to secure a 2-1 win over Slovakia in the next.

content.title: Mudryk on the attack for Ukraine

content.text: However a goalless draw against Belgium meant they failed to make the knockout stage.

Mudryk's first international goal after the Euros came in a Nations League group win over Georgia in October 2024 - the only goal of the game. A month later he helped Ukraine qualify for the play-offs in that competition.
